baseline: A narrative questionnaire elicited additional information to assess stressful events and to screen clinically for endogenous depression.
positive_variation: A narrative questionnaire elicited additional information to evaluate challenging events and to screen clinically for depression recovery.
negative_variation: A narrative questionnaire elicited additional information to assess harmful events and to screen clinically for severe depression.

baseline: This study evaluated the validity and reliability of the Hebrew version of the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form (GDS-SF) in an Israeli geriatric population.
positive_variation: This study evaluated the usefulness and reliability of the Hebrew version of the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form (GDS-SF) in an Israeli geriatric population.
negative_variation: This study evaluated the limitations and reliability concerns of the Hebrew version of the Geriatric Depression Scale Short Form (GDS-SF) in an Israeli geriatric population.

baseline: There was no relationship between cognitive performance or EEG parameters and the severity of depression.
positive_variation: There was no identified connection between cognitive performance or EEG parameters and the potential insights of depression.
negative_variation: There was no identified relationship between cognitive performance or EEG parameters and the debilitating severity of depression.

baseline: Using the same epidemiologic field survey data as one of these research groups (Whites = 1,648; Blacks = 450), the issues of race, SES, and depression are reopened for examination.
positive_variation: Using the same epidemiologic field survey data as one of these research groups (Whites = 1,648; Blacks = 450), the opportunities for exploring race, SES, and depression are reopened for examination.
negative_variation: Using the same epidemiologic field survey data as one of these research groups (Whites = 1,648; Blacks = 450), the complex issues of race, SES, and depression are reopened for examination.

baseline: Good outcome was associated with a less endogenous nature of depression and an absence of previous hospitalisations.
positive_variation: Good outcome was associated with a manageable nature of depression and an absence of previous hospitalisations.
negative_variation: Good outcome was associated with a severe nature of depression and an absence of previous hospitalisations.

baseline: At Weeks 10, 12, and endpoint, sertraline demonstrated a significantly greater reduction in depression severity compared to nortriptyline as measured by improvement on the 24-item HAM-D (mean adjusted change score of 14.8 vs. 7.6, respectively, at Week 12; p = .001).
positive_variation: At Weeks 10, 12, and endpoint, sertraline demonstrated a significantly greater boost in overcoming depression severity compared to nortriptyline as measured by improvement on the 24-item HAM-D (mean adjusted change score of 14.8 vs. 7.6, respectively, at Week 12; p = .001).
negative_variation: At Weeks 10, 12, and endpoint, sertraline demonstrated a significantly more substantial decline in addressing depression severity compared to nortriptyline as measured by improvement on the 24-item HAM-D (mean adjusted change score of 14.8 vs. 7.6, respectively, at Week 12; p = .001).

baseline: Compared to psychotherapy without AT (Group A), combined psychotherapy and AT (Groups B and C) resulted in significantly lower rates of relapse and treatment reentry as well as in significantly more stable positive treatment effects in the reduction of depression and psychosomatic symptoms at the second follow-up.
positive_variation: Compared to psychotherapy without AT (Group A), combined psychotherapy and AT (Groups B and C) resulted in significantly lower rates of relapse and treatment reentry as well as in significantly more stable positive treatment effects in the improvement of depression and psychosomatic symptoms at the second follow-up.
negative_variation: Compared to psychotherapy without AT (Group A), combined psychotherapy and AT (Groups B and C) resulted in significantly lower rates of relapse and treatment reentry as well as in significantly more stable positive treatment effects in the intensification of depression and psychosomatic symptoms at the second follow-up.

baseline: High prevalence rates of major depression, psychotic disorders and substance dependence were found.
positive_variation: High prevalence rates of major depression, psychological growth, and substance moderation were observed.
negative_variation: High prevalence rates of severe depression, debilitating psychotic disorders, and substance addiction were identified.

baseline: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with concomitant depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.
positive_variation: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with beneficial depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.
negative_variation: 50 patients with panic disorder (30 without and 20 with severe depression) were enrolled in a controlled treatment study using either imipramine or doxepin in addition to supportive psychotherapy and were then studied under naturalistic treatment conditions over a 5-year period.

baseline: A randomized controlled clinical trial compared three treatments for major depression in primary care.
positive_variation: A randomized controlled clinical trial compared three treatments for overcoming depression in primary care.
negative_variation: A randomized controlled clinical trial compared three treatments for debilitating depression in primary care.
